question: What is Granzyme B?
ideal_answer: Granzyme B is a serine protease that is secreted by Natural Killer (NK) cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes during a cellular immune response and can induce apoptosis.

snippets.text: expression of the non-specific cytotoxic cell marker (granzyme B, grb)
cytotoxic protein-positive cells, such as granzyme B cells
Granzyme B is known to be a serine protease contained in granules of cytotoxic T cells.
including cytotoxic T cells (CD8, Granzyme B, OX40, Ki67),
Granzyme B is a serine protease that is secreted by Natural Killer (NK) cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes during a cellular immune response and can induce apoptosis.
markers of activated cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CD8, granzyme-B)

exact_answer: Granzyme B is a serine protease
